Problem Overview

In this Problem, students analyze various methods for making fair decisions. Fictional students propose ways to make a number of decisions, which students need to evaluate. The proposals suggest some new ways to use spinners, number cubes, blocks, and drawing straws to help students think about probability simulations.

Emerging Mathematical Ideas

Continue making sense of equally likely outcomes determining the fairness of a game.

Begin to see that there are many things to consider when simulating an event.

Begin to notice/recognize:

  • A game is fair if the outcomes are equally likely to occur
  • A tool used to simulate a game must be able to simulate the indicated outcomes
  • Use a model to determine the probabilities of events
  • Design a simulation to generate frequencies for an event
  • Analyze possible simulations to determine which method will yield fair results

*GREEN BOX*

NWDYK

When using a tool to simulate a fair game, what things must you consider?
